variant.name: .TopLevelStorageAccess
variant.summary: Top-level Storage Access API permission actions

histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.BlockState
histogram.summary:
The observance of external protocol schemes that are denied or allowed by default built-in lists, enterprise policy, or user preference.
The kAllowedDefaultNews and kNewsNotDefault values are influenced by the PromptForExternalNewsSchemes feature. When enabled, kNewsNotDefault will be emtited with another histogram value to indicate whether it was allowed by policy, preference, or prompt. When disabled, the kAllowedDefaultNews sample will not be emitted.

histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.HandleState
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user checked the option in the external protocol dialog to remember their choice of opening or not opening the specified app. Recorded each time the user interacts with the External Protocol Dialog, when making a decision.

histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.Scheme
histogram.summary: Records the scheme of an external protocol request. Only logs schemes listed among the enum ExternalProtocolScheme. This is logged once for each request to open an external protocol.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.WithDisposition.{DispositionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the action that a user had taken per permission prompt UI disposition. Suffixed by the UI disposition that the prompt used. Recorded when a permission prompt has been resolved.

variant.name: AnchoredBubble
variant.summary: A bubble under the site settings padlock

variant.name: ElementAnchoredBubble
variant.summary: A bubble shown near the embedded permission element, when the element is clicked.

variant.name: LocationBarLeftChip
variant.summary: A chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that shows a bubble when clicked

variant.name: LocationBarLeftChipAutoBubble
variant.summary: A chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that automatically shows a bubble

variant.name: LocationBarLeftQuietAbusiveChip
variant.summary: A less prominent, non-animated version of a chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that shows a bubble when clicked

variant.name: LocationBarLeftQuietChip
variant.summary: A less prominent version of a chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that shows a bubble when clicked

variant.name: LocationBarRightAnimatedIcon
variant.summary: An animated indicator on the right-hand side of the location bar

variant.name: LocationBarRightStaticIcon
variant.summary: A static indicator on the right-hand side of the location bar

variant.name: MessageUI
variant.summary: A message bubble near top of the screen and below the location bar (alternative to Infobar UI)

variant.name: MiniInfobar
variant.summary: An initially-collapsed infobar at the bottom of the page

variant.name: NoneVisible
variant.summary: There was no UI being shown

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.{PermissionType}.CrossOriginFrame
histogram.summary: Recorded when a permission prompt has been resolved and the permission request was made from a cross-origin iframe. Records the action that a user had taken.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.{PermissionType}.CrossOriginFrame.TopLevelHeaderPolicy
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission prompt is shown to the user which was triggered by a request made from a cross-origin frame. Records what type of type of permission header policy the top-level document defined for the accessed feature.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action{PermissionTypes}
Permissions.ActivityIndicator.{Disposition}.{PermissionType}.{Action}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a permission activity indicator has been shown from in the location bar. Records the indicator's state.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.AvailableAtInquiryTime
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device AIv1 model is available when needed for permission request evaluation. Logged every time PermissionsAiHandler::InquireAiOnDeviceModel is called.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.ExecutionDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration it took to execute the on-device model. Logged only if the on-device AIv1 model was inquired successfully without getting cancelled.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.ExecutionSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device AIv1 model execution was successful or not. This required the model to be available and unbusy at inquiry time. This will not get logged when the session was canceled because it took too long; these failures are logged by the ExecutionTimeOut histogram instead.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.ExecutionTimedOut
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device AIv1 model ran into a timeout during execution. We do not want to block permission request evaluations too long because of lengthy on-device model executions, so we cancel them if they take more than 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.PreviousSessionFinishedInTime
histogram.summary: Records whether an inquiry to the on-device AIv1 model finishes in time to not hinder the next inquiries execution. Will get logged when an inquiry is requested with the model being available. It evaluates to false if the previous session is still running.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.ResponseParseSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device AIv1 model execution result's response parsing is successful or not. This is only logged when the model execution is successful.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv1.SessionCreationSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether a session was created successfully for the on-device AIv1 model each time we inquire the model. We also log failures when the model is not available.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv3.ModelHandlerProviderExists
histogram.summary: Records whether the PredictionModelHandlerProvider exists for the AIv3.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv3.PermissionsAiv3HandlerExists
histogram.summary: Records whether the PermissionsAiv3Handler exists for the AIv3.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv3.RelevanceHasValue
histogram.summary: Records whether the AIv3 model execution callback has a relevance value.

histogram.name: Permissions.AIv3.SnapshotTaken
histogram.summary: Records whether the snapshot needed as input for the AIv3 model was taken successfully. This could go wrong if the current render view was occluded (in the background) during the snapshot was taken.

histogram.name: Permissions.AndroidSystemLevel.{SystemPermissionType}.Prompt.Shown
histogram.summary: This histogram is logged whenever the Android systen level permission prompt for {SystemPermissionType} is shown. Records whether the system level permission was granted or denied. Permissions.Prompt.Shown is the baseline metric for this histogram. Android only.

histogram.name: Permissions.API.CreatedPermissionStatusObjects
histogram.summary: Records the number of PermissionStatus handles that have been created by a document (via the "navigator.permissions" API). Recorded at the destruction of said document. Only recorded if the document has created at least one PermissionStatus handle.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.EmbargoPromptSuppression
histogram.summary:
For every permission request that would show a prompt to the user, this metric tracks whether the request is suppressed by embargo (and the source of that embargo), or whether there is no embargo and the prompt is shown. This is the proportion of permission prompts that the user would have seen that have been blocked due to embargo.
If the (origin, permission) pair was previously placed under embargo, no prompt is displayed and the reason for embargo is recorded. Otherwise, the prompt is shown and a no embargo reason is recorded.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.EmbargoStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason that an (origin, permission) pair has been placed under embargo (blocked from making requests for that permission for a period of time). This is triggered when a permission is placed under embargo for blacklisting (once Safe Browsing has returned a result), when a permission prompt has been shown and it is placed under embargo for repeated dismissals, or when a permission prompt is shown and not embargoed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Chip.TimeToInteraction
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to click on the permission chip after it was shown.

histogram.name: Permissions.ConfirmationChip.PageInfoDialogAccessType
histogram.summary: Record each time the page info bubble is opened through either the lock icon or the confirmation chip, how it was opened and how the opening related to the confirmation chip.

histogram.name: Permissions.CPSS.SiteSettingsChanged.{Flavor}
histogram.summary: Record when CPSS setting is changed by users in the site settings page, what user preference is and whether user preference is related to UI changes.

variant.name: Quiet
variant.summary: Collapse all requests in the address bar.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.DidHoldbackQuietUi
histogram.summary: Whenever a notification permission prompt is to be displayed, crowd deny might trigger based on site reputation which will result in a quiet permission prompt UI to be used. Whenever this happens, there is a small chance that the normal UI will still be used. This records, when a quiet UI is supposed to be shown, whether it has been randomly selected into the hold-back group. In this case the normal UI will be displayed unless overriden by the user Prefences.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.DelayedPushNotification
histogram.summary: Record, for each incoming push notification, a delay caused by loading Crowd Deny component during abusive an origin verification. It's recorded only for non-abusive origins and only if the Crowd Deny request was made while the preload data is in the process of being loaded. Timing starts at requesting CrowdDenyPreloadData::GetReputationDataForSiteAsync, and timing ends after Crowd Deny returns result to AbusiveOriginPermissionRevocationRequest::OnSiteReputationReady.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.NotificationUxQuality
histogram.summary: Records, each time a notification permission prompt is about to be shown, the NotificationUxQuality result for the requesting origin.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.VersionAtAbuseCheckTime
histogram.summary: Records, each time abusive origin verification is performed, the version of the Crowd Deny preload data on disk (not necessarily loaded).

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.SafeBrowsing.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records, each time a Safe Browsing request is made in response to a website requesting the notification permission, how long that Safe Browsing request took. This also includes all delays introduced by thread hopping.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.SafeBrowsing.Verdict
histogram.summary: Records, each time a Safe Browsing request is made in response to a website requesting the notification permission, the Safe Browsing verdict regarding the notification prompt experience on that site.

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.AutoPermissionRevertTransition{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the Default Search Engine automatic permission grant is reverted. It tracks the transition that the settings for the DSE origin takes when this happens. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type. Only recorded for Android as that is the only platform where the DSE permissions were enabled. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.EffectiveSetting{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary: Recorded at initialization and when the Default Search Engine origin is changed. Tracks the setting for the Default Search Engine origin. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type. Only recorded for Android as that is the only platform where the DSE permissions were enabled. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Engagement.AcceptedOnce{PermissionRequestTypes}
Permissions.Engagement.Accepted{PermissionRequestTypes}
Permissions.Engagement.Denied{PermissionRequestTypes}
Permissions.Engagement.Dismissed{PermissionRequestTypes}
Permissions.Engagement.Ignored{PermissionRequestTypes}
Permissions.Experimental.PrimaryMainNavigationFinished.{PermissionType}.TopLevelHeaderPolicy
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a navigation finished in a primary main frame. Records what type of permission header policy the top-level document defined for the feature corresponding to {PermissionType} .

histogram.name: Permissions.Experimental.Usage.{PermissionType}.CrossOriginFrame.TopLevelHeaderPolicy
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission is used in a cross-origin frame. Records what type of permission header policy the top-level document defined for the accessed feature.

histogram.name: Permissions.Experimental.Usage.{PermissionType}.IsCrossOriginFrame
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission is used. Records whether the permission is used in a cross origin frame.

histogram.name: Permissions.GetLastCommittedOriginAsURL.IsFileURL
histogram.summary:
Recorded whenever a RenderFrameHost is used to fetch an origin for permission verification on Android. This histogram is needed to verify if the file url override rule is still needed.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-03 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Permissions.MissingOSLevelPermission.Action{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Chrome needs permission..." infobar is resolved. Records the resulting action that was taken. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.MissingOSLevelPermission.ShouldShow{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Chrome needs permission..." infobar might be displayed to the user because a site already has the permission but Chrome does not. Records whether the infobar should be displayed or not. Ignores situations when the infobar cannot be displayed (for example because there is no appropriate web contents) as in those cases no decision is actually made. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.OnDevicePredictionService.Response.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the permissions prediction service(on-device) responds to a {PermissionType} permission request. Records whether its response was ignored or not.

histogram.name: Permissions.OneTimePermission.Android.NegativeButtonOutOfScreen
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the negative button is shown on one time permission prompt Records whether the button is out of screen or not. Android only.

histogram.name: Permissions.OneTimePermission.{PermissionType}.Event
histogram.summary:
Logs granting, revocation, and expiry behaviors of one time permissions. Starting with M116, the lifetime limit is enforced actively instead of lazily, and expiration is accurately captured in "Expired after maximum lifetime". M116 also added the functionality to expire on suspend. This event is also captured in the new enum value "Expired because the device was suspended". Note that these buckets are only recorded for clients >= M116.
Warning: "Revoked one time grant manually" is only recorded correctly for clients >= M116 (and should be ignored for previous major versions)

histogram.name: Permissions.PageInfo.Changed.{PermissionType}.Reallowed.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records if a user manually reallowed permission state via PageInfo. Recorded when the user closes a tab, makes cross-origin navigation, or if permission is used by an origin. Grouped by whether permission was used, the page was reloaded and a "Reload this page" infobar was shown.

histogram.name: Permissions.PageInfo.Changed.{PermissionType}.{ReloadInfoBar}
histogram.summary: This metric measures how often and in what way users change permissions state via PageInfo and if we show a "Reload this page" info bar. Recorded when users changes permissions state or clicks the "Reset permission" button in PageInfo.

histogram.name: Permissions.PageInfo.ChangedWithin1m.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: This metric measures how often and in what way users change their mind within the first minute of making an active permission decision, i.e. any PermissionAction that is any action that is not ignore, dismiss or an automated revoke event.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.PredictionSource
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission is sent to the prediction service. Records whether the request was sent to the local on-device prediction service or the server side prediction service.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.Response.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the permissions prediction service(server-side) responds to a {PermissionType} permission request. Records whether its response was ignored or not.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.SignatureModel.Mismatch
histogram.summary: Recorded when the client does the on-device permission prediction using the signature runner. The histogram records whether the model that is downloaded is compatible with the signature runner or not. A value of true means its a mismatch, i.e. the model is not the signature runner model. False means otherwise.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorDismissCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorIgnoreCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.AcceptedOnce.PriorDismissCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt one-time accept, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.AcceptedOnce.PriorIgnoreCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt one-time accept, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.AcceptedOnce{PermissionRequestGesture}
histogram.summary:
Recorded when the user clicks on the one-time allow button of the permission prompt. Tracks the permission bubbles (merged and non-merged) that are accepted once. Merged bubbles are considered accepted if all permissions are allowed.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionRequestGesture}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted{PermissionRequestGesture}
Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorDismissCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorIgnoreCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied{PermissionRequestGesture}
Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorDismissCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-07-09 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorIgnoreCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Has{FaviconType}Favicon
histogram.summary: Records whether a permission prompt for a two origin scoped permission (e.g. StorageAccess) has successfully loaded a favicon. Recorded when a permission prompt with favicons is shown.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorDismissCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorIgnoreCount2{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary:
This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Notifications.EnabledAppLevel
histogram.summary: Records whether chrome has notifications already enabled at the app level or at least is allowed to request for app level permission. When none of these conditions are true, site level notification permissions are blocked. Recorded when a site attempts to prompt the user for notifications permission. Android only.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Shown{PermissionRequestGesture}
histogram.summary: Tracks how many times permission prompts are shown to users. {PermissionRequestGesture}

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.BrowserAlwaysActiveWhileShowing
histogram.summary: Records whether the browser was always active while the {PermissionType} prompt was displayed. Recorded when a permission prompt was destroyed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ElementAnchoredBubble.BrowserAlwaysActiveWhileShowing
Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ElementAnchoredBubble.DismissedReason
histogram.summary: Tracks how a {PermissionType} prompt was dismissed by the user. Tracked when the user dimisses an ElementAnchoredBubble prompt.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ElementAnchoredBubble.ShownInActiveBrowser
Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ElementAnchoredBubble.Variant
histogram.summary: Records which screen was shown to the user as part of an ElementAnchoredBubble permission prompt. Multiple screens can be shown sequentially as part of the same prompt. Is recorded when the screen is shown.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ElementAnchoredBubble.{OsScreen}.OsScreenAction
histogram.summary: Tracks the action taken on a {PermissionType} screen that informs the user about state of the OS settings. Recorded when the user interacts with this screen.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ElementAnchoredBubble.{OsScreen}.{OsScreenAction}.TimeToAction
histogram.summary: Tracks the time until an action is taken on a {PermissionType} screen that informs the user about state of the OS settings. Recorded whenever the user takes an action that results in closing the screen.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.ShownInActiveBrowser
histogram.summary: Records whether the browser was active at the time the {PermissionType} prompt was displayed. Recorded when a permission prompt started displaying.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Action}.WithBrowser
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user resolves the {PermissionType} permission prompt. Records whether the browser was always active before interacting with the prompt.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks the action that a user had taken for a {PermissionType} permission prompt with disposition of type {Disposition}. Recorded when a permission prompt has been resolved.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.Dismissed.Method
histogram.summary: Tracks how the user dismissed the {PermissionType} permission prompt with disposition of type {Disposition}. Recorded when a permission prompt has been resolved. Currently only implemented and reported for Clank.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.Ignored.DidShowBubble
histogram.summary: Records if a permission prompt bubble of type {PermissionType} was displayed as a result of a user having clicked on a chip with disposition {Disposition} that was subsequently ignored. Chip framework is only available on Desktop.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.IgnoredReason
histogram.summary:
Permission requests are categorized as ignored when the user failed to take action. This metric captures more detailed information on why a permission request was ignored.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-02-20 to 2024-09-06; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.{Action}.TimeToAction
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to take the {Action} action on a prompt of type {PermissionType} with {Disposition} disposition. The Ignored state will be recorded if the user closes the tab or a permission chip gets expired.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.{Action}.{ButtonClick}
histogram.summary:
Records {ButtonClick} if a user clicked on "Learn More" or "Manage" buttons on the quiet chip of type {PermissionType} with {Disposition} disposition. Recorded when the permission prompt gets resolved with {Action} action and only for the quiet chip.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-10-31 to 2024-11-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Gesture}.Attempt
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a permission prompt creation is in progress.
Note: The meaning of this metric's boolean value flipped for M-136, starting from 07.03.2025 (see crbug.com/400381904). Updated meaning: if this evaluates to true this means that the prompt could be displayed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Query.QueryResponseTime
histogram.summary:
Measure the response time of permissions.query as seen by Blink. This histogram is introduced to get a baseline for the performance in Clank and will be used to measure a future implementation of the API in WebView to compare the performance.
The histogram is emitted when Blink receives a callback from the browser process for the HasService call made as part of permissions.query.

histogram.name: Permissions.Query.TopLevelStorageAccess
histogram.summary: Records if the permission being queried is "top-level-storage-access" permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietChip.TimeToInteraction
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to click on the quiet chip after it was shown. Chip framework is only available on Desktop. Recorded only if the user clicks on the quiet chip. We can learn what % of prompts get ignored by comparing this metric and `PermissionPromptDisposition.LocationBarLeftQuietChip`.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietNotificationPrompts.EnabledStateInPrefsChangedTo
histogram.summary: Records when the quiet notification permission UI state changes, that is, it either gets enabled or disabled, in preferences.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietNotificationPrompts.{RegularProfileFiltered}IsEnabledInPrefs
histogram.summary: Records whether the quiet notification permission UI is enabled in preferences at profile creation. No sample recorded when notifications are set to be blocked completely.

variant.name: RegularProfile.
variant.summary: from version M-110. It is recorded only for regular profiles

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietPrompt.Preignore
histogram.summary: Records when a permission request was preignored because it will be shown as a quiet chip.

histogram.name: Permissions.Request.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission request is made by a cross-origin site, and before it is decided whether the request should be displayed to the user. Records the permission type of the request.

histogram.name: Permissions.Request.SameOrigin.{FrameLevel}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission request is made by a same-origin site, and before it is decided whether the request should be displayed to the user. Records the permission type of the request, and is grouped by whether the requesting frame is the main frame or a sub frame.

histogram.name: Permissions.Revocation.ElapsedTimeSinceGrant{PermissionTypes}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed since the grant of the permission until it's revoked. {PermissionTypes}

histogram.name: Permissions.Revocation.Notifications.DidRecordUkm
histogram.summary: Records, each time when the notification permission is revoked, whether a UKM event was recorded as well.

histogram.name: Permissions.Revocation.Notifications.SourceUI
histogram.summary: When revoking the notification from a website for push messaging, this records the PermissionSourceUI where it occurred.

histogram.name: Permissions.Serial.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the Serial API chooser, triggered by a call to navigator.serial.requestPort(), was closed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Serial.Revoked
histogram.summary: Records when permission to access a serial port is revoked.

histogram.name: Permissions.SiteSettingsChanged
histogram.summary: Records when and what content setting is changed in the site setting's page. Data recorded earlier than M135 is recorded directly with `ContentSettingsType` in `components/content_settings/core/common/content_settings_types.mojom`, which means they are probably in the wrong buckets and need to be viewed with cautious.

histogram.name: Permissions.Usage.ElapsedTimeSinceGrant.{PermissionType}.{Source}
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed since the grant of the permission until it's latest usage for a particular content setting source. This histogram will be recorded only for the first usage of a given permission after the site has loaded.

histogram.name: Permissions.Usage.ElapsedTimeSinceGrant{PermissionTypes}
Permissions.Usage.ElapsedTimeSinceLastUsage.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: Record each time when a site uses PermissionType. Duration represents buckets of time between two adjacent permission usages.

histogram.name: Permissions.Usage.Notifications.DidRecordUkm
histogram.summary: Records, each time when the notification permission is used, whether a UKM event was recorded as well.

histogram.name: Permissions.WebHid.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the WebHID device chooser was closed.

histogram.name: Permissions.{PredictionModel}.InquiryDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time it took for the permissions prediction service to inquire the {PredictionModel} and await its response for a permission request.

histogram.name: Permissions.{Version}.PermissionRequestRelevance
histogram.summary: Records the generated relevance signal after a successful execution of the available model.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementType
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MeanEngagement
histogram.summary:
The mean site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-03-12 to 2024-10-22; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MedianEngagement
histogram.summary: The median site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsEngaged
histogram.summary: The total number of origins with a non-zero site engagement score for this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the absolute site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum absolute site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the website setting (a.k.a. page info / origin info) bubble, such as opening it up or clicking on the Connection tab.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.AllSitesAction2
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the "All Sites" page in website settings starting in M82. No data available for M94, was temporarily expired. Values 7 and 8 were added with M96.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.
